content: trellis lace bookmark by libraryleigh materials list ✦fingering weight yarn about 25 yards used mini mochi mohair blend sock yarn ✦knitting needles us 2 pair double pointed or size to obtain gauge ✦tapestry or darning needle ✦beads gauge approximately 8 stitches per inch but not crucial itʼs a bookmark finished should be about 2 inches by 8 inches not including the tassel cast on 17 stitches knit 3 row row 4 knit 2 purl 13 knit 2 begin chart #1 chart notes read from bottom to top right to left only right side row are charted wrong side row knit 2 at beginning and end of each row purl all stitches in between bookmark is worked bottom to top repeat lace chart #1 three times then work chart #2 symbols knit knit right side purl wrong side j yarn over slip 1 k1 psso - slip one stitch knit next stitch pass slipped stitch over the knit stitch \ and off the needle | k2 decrease - knit two stitches together in front loops as one stitch sl 1 k2 decrease psso - slip 1 stitch knit next two stiches together pass the slipped stitch 2 over the knit stitch this makes a double decrease slanting to the left purl three stitches together r 1 chart #1 \ j \ j j | j | 17 \ j \ j j | j | 15 \ j \ j j | j | 13 \ j \ j j | 11 \ j \ j 9 j 2 j \ j 7 j | j 2 j \ j 5 j | j | \ j \ j 3 j | j | \ j \ j 1 chart #2 r 16 ppppppuuuuuurrrrrrllllll 333333 ttttttooooooggggggeeeeeetttttthhhhhheeeeeerrrrrr 2 15 2 13 | \ 11 | j 2 j \ 9 | j 2 j \ j \ 7 | j | j 2 j \ j \ 5 | j | j | \ j \ j \ 3 j | j | \ j \ j 1 cut yarn leaving an 8 tail draw yarn through last stitch thread beads onto tail then make a tassel to make the tassel wind yarn 30 times around a 2 piece of cardboard pass an 8 piece of yarn under the wound yarn on one side of the cardboard tie tightly cut yarn at other side of cardboard tie another 8 piece of yarn around the tassel about 1/2 inch above the first tie using a tapestry or darning needle pass the ends of both pieces of yarn into the middle of the tassel trim the ends evenly thread the yarn tail with the beads through the bottom of the tassel and back through the beads weave end into the bookmark i like to wet block my bookmark you could use starch but i like the soft feel of the mohair and it will keep your place either way - 2
